epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.time_representativeness: Plant data based on 2022 calendar year production data; mix data based on 2023 calendar year production data

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials to core processes; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck); treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution of concrete mixes; installation; wastage; transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.operational_control: No operational control by Holcim; assumptions based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: End-of-life fate beyond deconstruction and recycling is not controlled by Holcim; assumptions based on National Waste Report 2022

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, reducing net CO2 emissions

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach conforming to EN 15804

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017

Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
